channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Obstruction to bus routes, 16th September
item.description:
The vehicle has been abandoned for over a week with extensive damage to front near side currently facing the wrong way on the one way street it is causing issues with double decker buses.!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 40, Bloomfield Road, Plumstead, London

item.category: Pavement Defect (uneven surface / cracked paving slab)

item.title: Persistent litter, bags of dog faeces, etc on the public footpath across Deptford creek, 16th September
item.description:
There is daily litter including dog faeces (mostly bagged) on this major walking and cycling route. Of course people should not be dumping this rubbish but it is very noticeable that there is no public bin on this stretch and if one was installed it would be much cleaner, safer, and probably cost effective for the council as compared to clearing up the wider mess. Please can the area be cleaned and a bin (ideally general and dog waste both) be installed
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ha'penny Hatch, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic lights not on, 16th September
item.description:
Entire traffic light system is not on. I first noticed this when I tried to cross the road. This is very dangerous.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bayswater Road, Paddington, London

item.title: Street looks unclean, attracting foxes, 16th September
item.description:
They keep adding to this pile, which is now attracting wildlife. Our street is kept clean, but coming home to foxes sitting on a mattress. Our road looks embarrassing. This was been here for 4 weeks, they keep adding to it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Appletree Close, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Several St George’s flags attached to the street light posts, 16th September
item.description:
A group of 8 worked with 2 ladders to place St George’s flags on each streetlight pole along both sides of Hurst Rd. This is not anything to do with national pride, it is racism. The main culprit responsible was aggressive if challenged but they had a well planned operation so it was quickly done. These are two high to be removed without a ladder
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 80, Hurst Road, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Roadworks with NO signage, 16th September
item.description:
Chelsea Bridge has been taken down to one way only with temporary traffic lights - the traffic is horrendous both ways which given the shambles on Nine Elms Lane currently could not be less welcome. There is NO signage on these works to say what they are for or when they will be completed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chelsea Bridge, Pimlico, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wait button doesn’t work, 16th September
item.description:
Pedestrian crossing wait button outside golden goose theatre doesn’t work. The button doesn’t work so when you press it, light doesn’t come on. If someone on opposite side presses it then the light on pedestrian crossing comes on. So I think it’s the button specifically that doesn’t work. Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Vassall Road, Loughborough Junction, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car parking in the rd all day, 16th September
item.description:
Please can we have the rd back to drive in n and crossing safer for us who use it children going to school mothers with buggy person with disabilities every single weekday since school back and it just getting worse as it has been left no matter how many times we as a community report this problem high way code violation

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 72, Longton Grove, Forest Hill, London
